alert.note: Alert for Gove; Logan (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 29 at 4:26PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Logan and southwestern Gove Counties through 500 PM CDT... At 425 PM CDT, the public reported a strong thunderstorm 11 miles west of Scott State Lake, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Public reported accumulating hail 3 miles north of Leoti. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Logan and southwestern Gove Counties, including the following locations... The Monument Rocks. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This thunderstorm will produce strong winds resulting in areas of near zero visibility in blowing dirt. Use extreme caution if you must travel and be alert for rapidly changing visibility. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Goodland.
